Key Match Events: Malawi won 1-0 against Liberia with a goal from Chifundo Mphasi in the 80th minute
Malawi's Lloyd Aaron had a shot saved by Liberia goalkeeper Boison in the 5th minute
Malawi's Lanjesi Nkhoma and Stanley Sanudi took a shot corner, exchanged a few passes before crossing it inside for Chimwemwe Idana, who miscued his shot in the 7th minute
Pre-Game Insights: The Flames need to win against Tunisia to stay in contention for the 2026 FIFA World Cup
Tunisia is looking to erase their injured ego after defeats against Japan and South Korea
Malawi has tough contenders in the name of Tunisia, Sao Tome e Principe, and Equatorial Guinea
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Patrick Mabedi was criticized for his handling of the situation with Frank Gabadinho Mhango
FAM should intervene in the bad blood between Mabedi and Gaba to ensure the player is available for the next match
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Flames' coach, Patrick Mabedi, handed forward Olson Kanjira a debut but maintained the rest of the squad
The match against Liberia was a complex qualification format for the next two years and every man counts
The Flames have a chance to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup through the nine best runners-up from each group
Others: The Flames will play against Tunisia on Tuesday at Bingu Stadium
The Carthage Eagles will come to Malawi with the focus to erase their injured ego
The Flames have a chance to make it to the continental playoff
